title: Drawing, "Hebe Offering a Drink to Zeus", 1810–23
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Sitting god extends his right hand with bowl towards Hebe, who stands pouring ambrosia with both hands from pitcher. Juno appears beside Zeus. Putti with trumpets standing around. Above are flying putti with flowers, below two putti support dish with fruit. Below in right corner, sketch of part of young man extending his right arm.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Hebe Offering a Drink to Zeus", 1810–23.
1810–23. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1805.
